title: ISic001271. Dedication of a pavement by Klodianus and Mousa
body:
1Κλωδι[αν]ὸς
2κὲ Μοῦσα
3σὺν πεδίο̣[ις]
4ὑπὲρ εὐχῆς
5 ἐπ[οίησ]αν

l.2 reg., orig. κὲ

1ΚΛΩΔΙ[..]ΟΣ
2ΚΕΜΟΥΣΑ
3ΣΥΝΠΕΔΙ.[..]
4ΥΠΕΡΕΥΧΗΣ
5ΕΠ[....]ΑΝ

l.2 reg., orig. κὲ

Facsimile Images

Apparatus criticus

  • Text of Muscolino;
  • 6: Kaibel after Morso: ἐπέθηκαν

English translation

Klodianos and Mousa, together with their offspring, made this on account of a prayer/vow

commentary

Muscolino offers a revised reading, based upon a newly discovered apograph of 1810 from the time of the discovery, which diverges from that, based upon a separate apograph, of Morso 1823. Muscolino concludes that the text was incised on a marble plaque as part of a decorative stone floor, rather than being a mosaic text.

bibliography

  • 14.0446 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001072
  • Ferrua 1989 no.485 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001995
  • Muscolino 2017 107-116 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002808
  • Morso 1823 166-168 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10003137
